channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jack Smith, special prosecutor who pursued Trump, to testify publicly to Congress
item.description: Former Special Counsel Jack Smith, who pursued two criminal cases against President Trump during the Biden administration, will testify publicly about...

item.title: Are American College Students Brilliantly Disabled?
item.description: More students are reporting disabilities — and getting A’s.

item.title: The Cloying, Narcissistic, Theatrically Militant ‘Resistance’ Is Back
item.description: The Democratic Party could only suppress its own id for so long.

item.title: Trump imposes 25% tariff on any country doing business with Iran
item.description: President Trump on Monday imposed a 25% tariff on any country doing business with Iran amid Tehran's violent crackdown on mass protests.

item.title: Imagine If More Celebs Modeled Marriage And Pregnancy (In That Order) Like Josh Allen And Hailee Steinfeld
item.description: There’s something different and sincerely wholesome about the Allen family.

item.title: Senate GOP Prepares To Hold The Line On Hyde As White House Walks Back Trump’s ‘Be Flexible’ Remark
item.description: ‘I am absolutely committed to ensuring that no taxpayer funding is used to fund the radical left’s agenda, including abortion,’ Sen. Moreno said.

item.title: Trump Should Hope His Credit Card Interest Cap Never Becomes Policy
item.description: It is difficult to overstate how badly this idea would backfire.

item.title: The Trump Administration’s Lawfare Will Destroy More Than Just Itself
item.description: The cost of the politics of this era will be felt long after Trump is gone.

item.title: Another Court Disqualifies Another Trump Prosecutor, Ending Another Retributive Probe of Letitia James
item.description: The president is only hurting himself.

item.title: Election Integrity Activists Push Indiana Lawmakers To Outlaw ‘Disastrous’ Ranked-Choice Voting
item.description: 'Proponents of ranked-choice voting across the country are looking for weak points in state law to push ranked-choice voting.'
